topic.title: Create a Bucket for Access-Testing
topic.shortdesc: To perform application access-testing, start by creating a new bucket and populating it with documents.

section.title: Create a New Bucket
section.p: Access the Couchbase Web Console, and left-click on Buckets, in the left-hand navigation bar:
This brings up the Buckets view, which shows the buckets you currently have defined:
To create a new bucket, left-click on the + Add Data Bucket tab, which is located at the upper right:
This brings up the + Add Data Bucket dialog:

Note the message Grant users access to this bucket in Security/Users, which appears just below the Name field. This is indeed the step you will presently take, in order to define users and allocate them specific roles; and thereby restrict their access to this bucket.
Left-click on the Add Bucket button, at the lower right. The Buckets view now shows the new bucket you have created:
Left-click on the Documents tab, at the right of the composers row. This now shows details of the bucket: specifically, that it is empty.

section.title: Create Documents Within the New Bucket
section.p: Left-click on the Create Document tab. The Create Document dialog now appears:
Specify the name composer01, for the document you will create:
Left-click on the Save Document button. This brings up the Documents Editing view, in which you can define a document:
Type a document into the edit pane, located at the upper left, as follows:
Then, left-click on the Save button. This saves the document within the bucket. The message Document saved successfully! is briefly displayed.
Create two further documents, in the same way; naming them composer01 and composer02. The contents are as follows:
